contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:Hw-augustus.jpg|Emperor Augustus File:Hw-ivan4.jpg|Ivan IV of Russia File:Miguel de Cervantes.jpg|Miguel de Cervantes File:Miguel de Cervantes2.jpg|Miguel de Cervantes File:Ivan the Terrible (cropped).JPG|Ivan IV of Russia ("Ivan the Terrible") </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | '''[[National Religious Freedom Day]]''' in the United States | stub |- | [[929]] – Emir '''[[Abd-ar-Rahman III]]''' of [[Córdoba, Spain|Cordoba]] declared himself [[Caliphate|caliph]], thereby establishing the [[Caliphate of Córdoba]]. | refimprove section |- | [[1120]] – The '''[[Council of Nablus]]''' was held, establishing the earliest surviving written laws of the [[Crusader states|Crusader]] [[Kingdom of Jerusalem]]. | {{tl|Refimprove}} |- | [[1547]] – '''[[Ivan the Terrible]]''' was crowned the first [[Tsar]] of Russia at the age of 16. | tagged for expansion |- | [[1605]] – Book One of '''''[[Don Quixote]]''''', ''El ingenioso hidalgo Don Quijote de la Mancha'' by [[Miguel de Cervantes]], was first published in [[Madrid]], Spain. | unreferenced section |- | [[1917]] – [[World War I]]: The [[German Empire]] sent the '''[[Zimmermann Telegram]]''', a diplomatic proposal to Mexico to make war against the United States, which led in part to the U.S. entering the war. | refimprove section |- | [[1986]] – The '''[[Internet Engineering Task Force]]''', a [[standards organization]] that develops and promotes [[Internet standard]]s, held its first meeting, consisting of twenty-one United States-government-funded researchers. | {{tl|more footnotes}} |- | [[1991]] – The '''[[Gulf War]]''' began as a [[United Nations]]-led coalition began an assault on Iraqi forces to free Kuwait. | unreferenced section, more globalization |- | [[1992]] – The [[Chapultepec Peace Accords]]<!--Not bolded, stubby--> were signed, ending the 12-year '''[[Salvadoran Civil War]]''' between the military-led government of El Salvador and the [[Farabundo Martí National Liberation Front]]. | {{tl|ibid}} |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1780]] – [[American Revolutionary War]]: The British [[Royal Navy]] gained their first major naval victory over their European enemies in the war when they defeated a Spanish squadron in the '''[[Battle of Cape St. Vincent (1780)|Battle of Cape St. Vincent]]'''. {{*mp}} [[1920]] – The '''[[League of Nations]]''' held its first council meeting in Paris. {{*mp}} [[1942]] – '''[[TWA Flight 3]]''' crashed into [[Potosi Mountain]] in [[Nevada]], killing actress [[Carole Lombard]] and all of the other 21 people on board. {{*mp}} [[1969]] – Student '''[[Jan Palach]]''' [[self-immolation|set himself on fire]] in [[Wenceslas Square]] in [[Prague]] as a protest against the [[Soviet invasion of Czechoslovakia (1968)|Soviet invasion of Czechoslovakia]] the previous year. {{*mp}} [[2008]] – Five days after proposing [[lyrics]] for the wordless '''''[[Marcha Real]]''''', the Spanish [[national anthem]], the [[Spanish Olympic Committee]] withdrew the proposal due to widespread criticism. </ul> ==Notes== {{*mp}} [[Second Battle of the Corunna Road]] appears on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/January 15|January 15]], so Battle of Corunna should not appear in the same year to avoid confusion {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[January 16]]''': '''[[Teachers' Day]]''' in Thailand <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[File:BennyGoodmanStageDoorCanteen.jpg|Benny Goodman|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[27 BC]] – '''[[Augustus|Gaius Octavianus]]''' was given the title [[Augustus (honorific)|Augustus]] by the [[Roman Senate]] when he became the first [[Roman emperor]]. {{*mp}} [[1809]] – [[Peninsular War]]: French forces under [[Nicolas Jean de Dieu Soult]] '''[[Battle of Corunna|attacked]]''' the amphibious evacuation of the British under [[John Moore (British Army officer)|Sir John Moore]] in [[A Coruña|Corunna]], [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]], Spain. {{*mp}} [[1919]] – The '''[[Eighteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Eighteenth Amendment]]''' to the [[United States Constitution|U.S. Constitution]] was ratified by thirty-six of the forty-eight states, establishing the [[Prohibition in the United States|prohibition of alcoholic beverages]] in the United States. {{*mp}} [[1938]] – '''[[Benny Goodman]]''' ''(pictured)'' performed a concert at New York City's [[Carnegie Hall]] which has been considered instrumental in establishing [[jazz]]<!--not bold, factoid not in article--> as a legitimate form of music. {{*mp}} [[1945]] – [[World War II]]: [[Adolf Hitler]] and his staff moved into the '''''[[Führerbunker]]''''', where he would eventually [[Death of Adolf Hitler|commit suicide]]. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=January|Day=16}}<noinclude> </noinclude>
